POSTAL COMMEMORATIVE SOCIETY
47 RICHARDS AVENUE, NORWALK, CONNECTICUT 06857 (203) • 853-2000
Dear Member:
The enclosed Cover, "World's First Airmail
Flight,
" contains a postmark that was not very
carefully affixed by the postal authorities of
Allahabad, India.
We are not pleased with the
clarity of the postmark, but through conversations
with the local
authorities, it is apparent that we
have no hope of having replacement Covers post-
marked any better.
I have sent this Cover to you (despite its
postmark) because it commemorates one of the most
significant
"firsts"
in flight -- the world's first
airmail flight -- and is a Cover I am sure you will
want to own to tell the complete story of flight.
So, despite its unclear postmark, I hope you
will look at this Cover the same way I did when I
added it to my collection:
as a Cover that commem-
orates one of the most significant events in the
history of flight, whose postmark attests to the
incredibly complex journey the Cover took to
Allahabad, India and back again.
Sincerely,
Ateve Hordon
Steve Gordon
Program Manager

properties.sfomuseum:description: a. Airmail flight cover, part of International Tributes to the History of Flight series by the Postal Commemorative Society; white envelope with full color illustration cachet and inset stamp commemorating world’s first/inaugural airmail flight on February 18, 1911, in Allahabad, India, by Henry Pequet with Humber-Sommer biplane; cancellation stamp dated February 18, 1984 in Allahbad; includes information on reverse.b. Supplemental form letter, Postal Commemorative Society.
